title: Logo series for design portal
content:
Hello,

for upcomming design portal (reviewing design, trends) I created this logo series. It stands for 3 different categories: online, offline, brand. Are logos understandable or operate just like cliparts? The problem was, that there is not much space for logo, because portal was designed first. So logo concept had to fit there. At 2th picture you can see how its integrated in the website.

[http://www.kahlkopf.com/files/stylespin.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020032044/http:/www.kahlkopf.com/files/stylespin.gif "http://www.kahlkopf.com/files/stylespin.gif")  
 [http://www.kahlkopf.com/files/stylespin\_web.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020032044/http:/www.kahlkopf.com/files/stylespin_web.jpg "http://www.kahlkopf.com/files/stylespin\_web.jpg")
author: Wadim Kahlkopf

comments.content:
I think the blue & green logos look better than the red one

the red one reminds me of Firefox logo

& I like the green logo composition.... it is more balanced

and fits more with the (stylespin)

I quite like it ... what about version that combines all three colour ways?

they certainly don't scream "online offline brand" but they work pretty nicely in context.

----------  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Graphic Design Melbourne](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020032044/http:/www.solid-creative.com/)  
 [Short Film Festival](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020032044/http:/www.showusyourshorts.com.au/)
